author: cnbc.com
title: UPDATE 1- Healthineers' smaller than expected
text:
* Price range for 150 mln shares 26-31 eur apiece
* Values Healthineers at up to 31 bln eur
* Valuation had been expected at about 35 bln eur (Recasts with valuation, adds detail)
  set the price range for the planned initial public offering (IPO)   business on Sunday, valuing the division at a smaller than expected 31 billion euros ($38.18 billion).
  March.
In what would be   years, Siemens plans to sell up to 15 percent of the division -- or a maxiumum of 150 million shares -- at a price range of between 26 euros and 31 euros per share, it said on Sunday.
That would bring the parent proceeds of between 3.9 billion euros and   billion).
The IPO had been expected to value the maker of medical imaging and diagnostics gear at about 35 billion euros.
Siemens is expected to publish the listing prospectus on Monday.
Investment banks Goldman Sachs, Deutsche Bank and JP Morgan will act as joint global coordinators, helped by BNP Paribas, BofA Merrill Lynch, Citigroup and UBS.
The offer period is expected to run from March 6-15.   Additional reporting by Alexander Huebner and Ludwig Burger Editing by Alexander Smith and David Goodman)
